title: Revert theme/images, remove mobile number, remove login button

requirements.text: Revert the visual theme to the previous version: restore the original color palette, typography, and styling that existed before version 44. Undo any theme changes introduced in version 44.

quotes: I want the old theme and images back

acceptanceCriteria: The site's color scheme, fonts, and layout match the pre-version-44 appearance.
No visual changes from the v44 theme update remain visible.

requirements.text: Restore all original images that were replaced or removed in version 44. Revert any CSS-based visuals back to the original image assets.

quotes: I want the old theme and images back

acceptanceCriteria: All images that existed before the v44 update are displayed again.
No CSS placeholder visuals are shown in place of original images.

requirements.text: Remove the mobile/phone number from every location it appears across the entire site, including the Header, Footer, Contact page (contact info cards), and any other components or pages that display it.

quotes: remove the mobile number from everywhere on site

acceptanceCriteria: No phone or mobile number is visible anywhere on the site.
The Footer no longer displays a phone number.
The Contact page no longer displays a phone number.
No other page or component displays a phone number.

requirements.text: Remove the login button from the Header navigation. The login/authentication UI element (Internet Identity login button) must not be visible to any site visitor.
acceptanceCriteria: The login button is not rendered in the desktop navigation.
The login button is not rendered in the mobile navigation menu.
No login or sign-in prompt is visible to unauthenticated users on any page.

constraints: Do not modify backend logic or data models.
Do not alter immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, or the ui components directory.
The admin-only routes (LeadsPage, InitializeAdminPage) may retain internal authentication logic but must not expose the login button publicly.
nonGoals: Do not add any new features or content.
Do not change the site's copy, services, or SEO metadata.
Do not remove admin authentication functionality from protected routes â€” only hide the public-facing login button.
